Package micycle.peasygradients.utilities

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • micycle.peasygradients.utilities.Functions
  • public final class Functions
extends Object
    This class contains static functions mostly related to color/gradient processing.

    micycle1

    • Method Detail

      • linearProject

        public static float linearProject​(float originX,
                                  float originY,
                                  float destX,
                                  float destY,
                                  int pointX,
                                  int pointY)
        Project a given 2D pixel coordinate (x, y) onto a position (0...1) of a imaginary 1D spine of a linear gradient given by its start and end points.
        Parameters:
        originX - x coord of gradient spline origin
        originY - y coord of gradient spline origin
        destX - x coord of gradient spline destination
        destY - y coord of gradient spline destination
        pointX - x coord of point to project onto spline
        pointY - y coord of point to project onto spline
        Returns:
        position (0...1) that the point occurs on in a gradient [0...1]

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • formatArray

        public static String formatArray​(double[] array,
                                 int decimalPlaces,
                                 int padding,
                                 char open,
                                 char close)
        Returns of string representation of the input array; array values are formatted to n decimal places, and padded with zeros (optional).
        Parameters:
        array -
        decimalPlaces - number of decimal places to retain
        padding - default is 3 when decimal places = 0
        open - character to open the array. e.g. '['
        close - character to close the array. e.g. ']'
        Returns:
        something like "[1, 2, 3, 4]"

      • veryVeryFastPow

        public static double veryVeryFastPow​(double a,
                                     double b)
        pow approximation with exponentiation by squaring. Very fast, but with appreciable inaccuracy. https://pastebin.com/ZW95gEyr
        Parameters:
        a - base
        b - exponent
        Returns:
        a^b (roughly)

      • fastRound

        public static int fastRound​(float value)
        Fast round from float to int. This is faster than Math.round() though it may return slightly different results. It does not try to handle NaN or infinities.

      • fastAtan

        public static double fastAtan​(double z)
        Polynomial approximating arctangenet on the range -1, 1. Implementation of function in 'Efficient Approximations for the Arctangent Function' by Rajan et al. Maximum absolute error of 0.0038 rad (0.22ยบ)
        Parameters:
        z -
        Returns:

        public static double fastAtan2a​(double y,

        Parameters:
        y -
        x -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        #fastAtan(float)

      • lerpAngle

        public static float lerpAngle​(float fromRadians,
                              float toRadians,
                              float progress)
        Linearly interpolates between two angles in radians. Takes into account that angles wrap at two pi and always takes the direction with the smallest delta angle.
        Parameters:
        fromRadians - start angle in radians
        toRadians - target angle in radians
        progress - interpolation value in the range [0, 1]
        Returns:
        the interpolated angle in the range [0, 2PI]

      • lineRectIntersection

        public static processing.core.PVector[] lineRectIntersection​(processing.core.PVector[] rect,
                                                             processing.core.PVector point,
                                                             float angle)
        Finds the two points of intersection between a rectangle and a line, which given by a point inside the rectangle and an angle.

        A Java/Processing implementation of this SE Game Dev answer.

        Parameters:
        rectCoords - a float[4] containing the rectangle corner coordinates {UL,BL,BR,UR}
        point - 2D coordinates of point within rectangle (i.e. where the line originates from)
        angle - angle of line in radians (where 0 faces east). Increases in a clockwise manner
        Returns:
        PVector[2] containing the two points of intersection
        See Also:
        lineRectIntersection(float, float, PVector, float)

      • lineRectIntersection

        public static processing.core.PVector[] lineRectIntersection​(float rectWidth,
                                                             float rectHeight,
                                                             processing.core.PVector point,
                                                             float angle)
        An x-axis & y-axis aligned version of this method.

        This method expects a rectangle that is defined solely by it's size (width and height). Its top left corner lies on the origin [0,0]. The Y-axis of the coordinate system expands downwards.

        Parameters:
        rectWidth -
        rectHeight -
        point - 2D coordinates of point within rectangle (i.e. where the line originates from)
        angle - angle of line in radians (where 0 faces east). Increases in a clockwise manner
        Returns:
        PVector[2] containing the two points of intersection
        See Also:
        lineRectIntersection(PVector[], PVector, float)
